data.title: Add the ability to disable/enable or delete all breakpoints
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
Version 1.9.1
Commit f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519
Date 2017-02-08T23:44:55.542Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143

- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

This is a nice to have. Sometimes when debugging you may want to disable all breakpoints for whatever reason and then at some point put them all back. You may also want to delete all breakpoints. This kind of functionality exists in Visual Studio.

I'd be happy to tackle this if someone could point me to the general vicinity in the code base where breakpoints are handled.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to debug menu, and press 'Start debugging' at least twice (or double click F5).
2. Same debug configuration is launched multiple times.

Expectation:

No possibility to run the same configuration (accidentally) as there is an alternative feature which is called compound which lets the user do that. @isidorn

data.title: Feature Request: Expose LanguageConfigurationRegistry as extension API
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `1.9.1`
- OS Version: `Windows 10`

Hello

For my extension I would like to access the current document comment and bracket style. I took a look at how this is achieved in VSCode: `lineCommentCommand.ts -> _gatherPreflightCommentStrings` and learned that I require the `LanguageConfigurationRegistry` . However this is not accessible to extension developers.

data.title: PreLaunchTask first run does not complete
data.body:
1. Generate a new TS-Extension with `yo code`
2. Open that extension in VSCode
3. Hit `F5` - notice how the preLaunchTask never finishes - the status bar indicator is always spinning
4. If I start debugging again the prelaunchTask will finish nicely now

Assigning to you since I know you are refactoring some things in the task framework and I did not touch any code on my end lately.

data.title: vscode not recognizing .csproj file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: win

Steps to Reproduce:

1. have installed web api start project using this command 
yo aspnet webapi MyFirstASPNetCoreWebAPI

I've followed these links to create web api project template
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/client-side/yeoman?#building-projects-with-yeoman
https://github.com/OmniSharp/generator-aspnet

2. open the project in vscode

3. It shows there are unresolved dependancies from .csproj. Please execute the restore command to continue. clicking restore shows this error in "Output"

error: Invalid input 'd:\Projects\vs-code-web\WebAPI1\WebAPI1.csproj'. The file type was not recognized.
Done: 1.

data.title: Installation of "the 'SQL' extension" recommended, not available.
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.9.1 - OS Version: macOS 10.12.3 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a .sql file 2. Observe recommendation notice. 3. Click "Show Recommendations" At the top of the window, the recommendation notice comes down with the message: "It is recommended to install the 'SQL' extension." Buttons presented are "Show Recommendations" "Don't Show Again" and "Close". Clicking Show Recommendations presents a list of extensions that does not include any titled "SQL", the closest would be the Microsoft SQL Server-specific "mssql" extension. Searching all extensions for the substring "SQL" shows no extension with the title of simply "SQL". If the intent of the notice is to encourage the user to select one of the SQL-related extensions, e.g., mssql, PL/SQL, vscode-database, then the Show button should take the user to a list of extensions tagged as SQL related, and the wording of the notice should be corrected, as "the 'SQL' extension" means one specific, so named extension. If there is/was a specific extension simply called "SQL" that is not available at this moment, the notice could be removed or linked directly to that extension. Even if the extension is not available, it would be a clearer user-experience to click Show… and be taken to a "this extension is no longer available" page.

data.title: CPU has been drained by PHP7.0 process
data.body:
The CPU usage is about 100% when the editor is started.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-08T23:44:55.542Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-62-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|format-php|Kasik96|1.1.2|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|1.3.3|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|prettier-vscode|esbenp|0.8.0|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|1.1.1|
|classic-asp|ilich8086|0.0.2|
|php-symbols|linyang95|2.1.0|
|wordpress-snippet|tungvn|1.1.2|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|1.0.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I started the editor and I ran the linux top command
2. The usage of CPU is close to 100% and the responsible for that is the php7.0 process
3. When I close the editor the php7.0 process is terminated and the CPU usage backs to normal

I do not know whether it is an editor issue or some extension.

data.title: run tests in renderer
data.body: This PR runs our whole test suite in the electron renderer process to be more close to what we actually ship and to allow more dom-aware tests

data.title: [html] support for base url
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an HTML document.
2. Add a `<base>` tag.
3. Add a link with a relative URL.
4. Try to follow the link with CTRL + Click.

```Html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

<head>
    <title>Test</title>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <base href="../">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="folder/file.css">
```

I'm not sure it's really a bug, maybe more a missing feature.

data.title: Problem with VSC program path (when update) and .vscode
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I instaled VSC on d:/VSC or e:/VSC
2. When updating VSC then have new instalation is created in C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code, not on d:/VSC or e:/VSC
3. The idea to install VSC on d:/VSC or e:/VSC is for some case of portable think for VSC as pendrive or cases of re-instaling all OS (then all is on d:/ or e:/ and no problem). But all plugins are on VSC on C:\Users\ManPython\.vscode and when c: partition is destroyed or formated, then must install again all extensions, etc.
- change path for .vscode (and live move/relocation with all files to other path) is important and usefull eg. next to main  VSC program files
- we can imagine 2 or more instances of VSC with other extensions or settings (but .vscode can't be one an in default path as C:\Users\ManPython\.vscode but other)

data.title: [Feature] Multiple Editor Window Support
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: 10.0.15031.0

I would love to see the ability to have multiple editor windows open to support workstations with multiple monitors. I see this working similar to Visual Studio or Chrome, where pulling a tab out of the main window and to the desktop creates a new (editor-only) window, which can then itself have multiple tabs and be redocked in the main window by dragging it back.

data.title: Unable to Delete files on Windows

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select a file in the Explorer
2. Right mouse click and select Delete

The file does not get deleted. Instead an error message is displayed: 

    [Error] Cannot read property 'object' of undefined             [Close]

Opening the Integrated Terminal and entering in the following deletes the file without any errors. 

    del src\app\path\to\file.component.scss

data.title: Preserve EOL type

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

We already have `{"files.eol": "\r\n" or "\n"}` to set default EOL type. I suggest splitting this setting into two parts:

- `files.eol`: (No change).
- `files.preserveEOL`: If set to `true`, EOL of old files will be preserved. If set to `false`, EOL of old files will be set according to `files.eol`. New files will still follow `files.eol`.

data.title: Snippet failing to function consecutively
data.body:
Edit: I believe I have found the problem, typically one will realise it immediately after posting a bug report. It seems to be conflicting with an autocompletion that takes precedence:

![screen shot 2017-02-16 at 9 25 09 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/319567/23017483/89c8068c-f48e-11e6-87b5-d331e155f5f6.png)

What's the workaround for that? Should the snippet be prioritised?

---

Possibly related to #11742

Behaviour:

![feb-16-2017 21-21-14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/319567/23017355/0600c1c2-f48e-11e6-91b6-53cbd707dca4.gif)

I'm interested if anyone else can reproduce this as easily as I can, I haven't had time to dig into it any further but it's been a problem for quite a while.

This is the snippet:

```
	"Print to console": {
		"prefix": "log",
		"body": [
			"console.log($1);"
		],
		"description": "Log output to console"
	},
```

data.title: allow getting defenitions without the need for a .d.ts file
data.body:
you can close this if this is already implemented/vague.

Code Lensing and Intellisense seems to be limited when there's a ``.d.ts`` present or for local files only (when there's a Decorator present in the file).

Allowing VS Code to look through definitions in NPM/Local libraries relaxes the need for a ``.d.ts`` for Intellisense.

data.title: colapse multi-line comments even if they don't have spaces/tabs before the lines
data.body:
i have already filed [an issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/issues/805) under Microsoft/vscode-go , but it seems vscode do  colapsing work

for a golang project:
https://golang.org/doc/effective_go.html#commentary gives an example of block comment which has no space/tab before the lines.

all of `.go` source files in Kubernetes project have package comments , and all of these package comments have no space / tab before the lines.

gogland EAP version can colapse this kind of comments even when they don't have no space / tab before the lines.
![image 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1210201/23015723/dcb74daa-f46e-11e6-8eeb-02c04d232dd1.png)

so i sugguest :
even when multi-line comments have no space/tab preceding the lines, vscode  should colapse this kind of comments.

data.title: Vscode font get messed up if i install wine

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.9.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Install vscode
2.Install wine using command sudo apt-get install wine

When wine is installed, the vscode fonts get messed up. The font size gets smaller and ugly. If i zoom(using 'ctr' + '+'), the font gets too big and still stay ugly.

When i uninstall wine, and run 'sudo apt autoremove', everything is back to normal again.
